intro: Acinodendron regnellii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. It is often found in sandy soils and is part of the Rhamnaceae family. Due to its resilience in harsh environments, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
